GLOBAL.d: Specifies a unique id for an element
Specifies whether an element is draggable or not
Specifies whether the dragged data is copied, moved, or linked, when dropped
Used to store custom data private to the page or application
Specifies a shortcut key to activate/focus an element
Specifies the language of the element's content
Specifies the tabbing order of an element
Specifies whether the element is to have its spelling and grammar checked or not
Specifies an inline CSS style for an element
Specifies the text direction for the content in an element
Specifies whether the content of an element should be translated or not
Specifies that an element is not yet, or is no longer, relevant
Specifies extra information about an element
Specifies whether the content of an element is editable or not
Specifies a context menu for an element. The context menu appears when a user right-clicks on the element
Specifies one or more classnames for an element (refers to a class in a style sheet)
The type of tag the element is
The complete contents of the element
The complete text contents of the element

n.d: Specifies the URL of the page the link goes to
Specifies the language of the linked document
Specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document
Specifies that the target will be downloaded when a user clicks on the hyperlink
Specifies the target for where to open the linked document or where to submit the form
Specifies what media/device the linked document is optimized for

area.d: Specifies that the target will be downloaded when a user clicks on the hyperlink
Specifies the language of the linked document
Specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document
Specifies the URL of the page the link goes to
Specifies an alternate text when the original element fails to display
Specifies the target for where to open the linked document or where to submit the form
Specifies the shape of the area
Specifies what media/device the linked document is optimized for

area.dt: COORDS(IF SHAPE = RECT(x1,y1,x2,y2)|IF SHAPE = CIRCLE(x,y,radius)|IF SHAPE = POLYGON(x1,y1,x2,y2,..,xn,yn))
area.d: Specifies the coordinates of the area

audio.d: Script to be run when the playing position has changed (like when the user fast forwards to a different point in the media)
Script to be run when an error occurs
Specifies that the audio/video will start playing as soon as it is ready
Specifies if and how the author thinks the audio/video should be loaded when the page loads
Script to be run when the media has reach the end (a useful event for messages like "thanks for listening")
Script to be run when the length of the media changes
Specifies the URL of the audio file
Script to be run when the media is paused either by the user or programmatically
Script to be run when the media is ready to start playing
Script to be run when a file can be played all the way to the end without pausing for buffering
Script to be run when the media has paused but is expected to resume (like when the media pauses to buffer more data)
Script to be run each time the volume of a video/audio has been changed
Script to be run when a file is ready to start playing (when it has buffered enough to begin)
Specifies that the audio/video will start over again, every time it is finished
Specifies that the audio/video will start over again, every time it is finished
Script to be run on abort
Script to be run when the media actually has started playing.
Script to be run when media data is loaded
Script to be run when fetching the media data is stopped before it is completely loaded for whatever reason
Script to be run when something bad happens and the file is suddenly unavailable (like unexpectedly disconnects)
Script to be run just as the file begins to load before anything is actually loaded
Script to be run when the browser is in the process of getting the media data
Script to be run each time the playback rate changes (like when a user switches to a slow motion or fast forward mode).
Script to be run when the browser is unable to fetch the media data for whatever reason
Script to be run when meta data (like dimensions and duration) are loaded
Specifies that audio/video controls should be displayed (such as a play/pause button etc)
Script to be run when the seeking attribute is set to true indicating that seeking is active
Script to be run when the seeking attribute is set to false indicating that seeking has ended
Specifies that the audio output of the video should be muted

base.d: Specifies the URL of the page the link goes to
Specifies the target for where to open the linked document or where to submit the form

blockquote.d: Specifies a URL which explains the quote/deleted/inserted text

body.d: Script to be run when a Web Storage area is updated
Script to be run when the window's history changes.
Script to be run when there has been changes to the anchor part of the a URL
Script to be run when a page has unloaded (or the browser window has been closed)
Script to be run when an error occurs
Script to be run when the browser starts to work offline
Script to be run when the browser window is being resized.
Script to be run after the document is printed
Script to be run before the document is printed
Script to be run when the document is about to be unloaded
Script to be run when the browser starts to work online
Script to be run when the element is finished loading
Script to be run when a user navigates to a page
Script to be run when a user navigates away from a page

button.d: Specifies the name of the element
Specifies the value of the element
Specifies that the specified element/group of elements should be disabled
Specifies where to send the form-data when a form is submitted. Only for type="submit"
Specifies that the element should automatically get focus when the page loads
Specifies the name of the form the element belongs to

canvas.d: Specifies the width of the element
Specifies the height of the element

col.d: Specifies the number of columns to span

colgroup.d: Specifies the number of columns to span

del.d: Specifies a URL which explains the quote/deleted/inserted text

details.d: Specifies that the details should be visible (open) to the user
Script to be run when the user opens or closes the <details> element

embed.d: Script to be run when an error occurs
Script to be run on abort
Specifies the URL of the embed file
Script to be run when a file is ready to start playing (when it has buffered enough to begin)
Specifies the width of the element
Specifies the height of the element

fieldset.d: Specifies the name of the form the element belongs to

form.d: Specifies that the form should not be validated when submitted
Specifies where to send the form-data when a form is submitted
Specifies whether the <form> or the <input> element should have autocomplete enabled
Specifies the target for where to open the linked document or where to submit the form
Specifies how the form-data should be encoded when submitting it to the server (only for method="post")
Specifies the name of the element
Specifies the HTTP method to use when sending form-data
Script to be run when a reset button in a form is clicked.
Script to be run when a form is submitted
Specifies the character encodings that are to be used for the form submission

iframe.d: Specifies the HTML content of the page to show in the <iframe>
Specifies the height of the element
Specifies the width of the element
Enables an extra set of restrictions for the content in an <iframe>
Specifies the URL of the iframe file
Specifies the name of the element
Script to be run when the element is finished loading

img.d: Specifies the URL of the image to use in different situations
Specifies the size of the linked resource
Specifies an image as a server-side image-map
Script to be run when an error occurs
Specifies the URL of the imagea file
Script to be run when the element is finished loading
Specifies the width of the element
Specifies an image as a client-side image-map
Specifies the height of the element

input.d: Specifies the width of the element
Specifies the type of element
Specifies the width, in characters (for <input>) or specifies the number of visible options (for <select>)
Specifies an alternate text when the original element fails to display
Specifies the value of the element
Specifies a short hint that describes the expected value of the element
Specifies a minimum value
Specifies a regular expression that an <input> element's value is checked against
Specifies that a user can enter more than one value
Specifies where to send the form-data when a form is submitted. Only for type="submit"
Specifies that the text direction will be submitted
Specifies that the element must be filled out before submitting the form
Specifies the legal number intervals for an input field
Script to be run when the user writes something in a search field (for <input="search">)
Specifies that the element should automatically get focus when the page loads
Specifies that an <input> element should be pre-selected when the page loads (for type="checkbox" or type="radio")
Specifies the name of the element
Specifies that the specified element/group of elements should be disabled
Refers to a <datalist> element that contains pre-defined options for an <input> element
Specifies the height of the element
Specifies the types of files that the server accepts (only for type="file")
Specifies the name of the form the element belongs to
Specifies the maximum value
Specifies the URL of the input file
Script to be run when the element is finished loading
Specifies that the element is read-only
Specifies the maximum number of characters allowed in an element
Specifies whether the <form> or the <input> element should have autocomplete enabled

ins.d: Specifies a URL which explains the quote/deleted/inserted text

label.d: Specifies the name of the form the element belongs to
Specifies which form element(s) a label/calculation is bound to

li.d: Specifies the value of the element

link.d: Specifies what media/device the linked document is optimized for
Specifies the language of the linked document
Script to be run when the element is finished loading
Specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document
Specifies the URL of the page the link goes to
Specifies the size of the linked resource

map.d: Specifies the name of the element

menu.d: Script to be run when a <menu> element is shown as a context menu

meta.d: Provides an HTTP header for the information/value of the content attribute
Specifies the name of the element
Gives the value associated with the http-equiv or name attribute

meter.d: Specifies the name of the form the element belongs to
Specifies the value of the element
Specifies the range that is considered to be a low value
Specifies the range that is considered to be a high value
Specifies what value is the optimal value for the gauge

Specifies the width of the element

ol.d: Specifies that the list order should be descending (9,8,7...)

optgroup.d: Specifies the title of the text track

option.d: Specifies the value of the element

Specifies that an option should be pre-selected when the page loads

progress.d: Specifies the value of the element

q.d: Specifies a URL which explains the quote/deleted/inserted text

Script to be run when the element is finished loading

Script to be run when the element gets selected

Script to be run when a user is pressing a key
Script to be run when the element is invalid
Script to be run when the element gets user input
Script to be run when the element gets focus

Script to be run when the user pastes some content in an element

Script to be run at the end of a drag operation
